actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade

official_title: To provide that the President may not prohibit or curtail the export to any country of agricultural commodities produced in the United States unless that country is engaged in war or military hostilities against the United States.

summary.text: Agricultural Commodity Embargo Limitation Act - Provides that the President may not prohibit or restrict the export of U.S. agricultural products to any country unless: (1) a state of war exists between such country and the United States; or (2) the President certifies to the Congress that such country is engaged in military hostilities against the United States and such certification is in effect.

titles.title: To provide that the President may not prohibit or curtail the export to any country of agricultural commodities produced in the United States unless that country is engaged in war or military hostilities against the United States.
